measurements_data.source: NBSC (National Bureau of Statistics of China). 2016. "China Statistical Yearbook: Collection, Transport and Disposal of Consumption Wastes in Cities by Region (2016)." China Statistics Press. Accessed April 23, 2017. http://www.stats.gov.cn/tjsj/ndsj/2016/indexeh.htm.

Yue Bo, et.al. 2014. "Characteristics of Rural Household Waste in China." Environmental Science & Technology (in Chinese), 37 (6): 129-134.
measurements_data.comments:
Urban waste generation is 0.78 kg/capita/day, total generation of 242.062 million tonnes in 2019. Urban domestic waste generation in 2019 is 242.062 million tonnes with a corresponding urban population of 848.43 million people. Data on MSW generation in urban areas is collected from the treatment plants and is likely an underestimation. It does not account for the removal of recyclables collected by scavengers before the waste reaches the treatment plants.

Rural waste generation is estimated to be 0.76 kg/capita/day (2014 data), for an estimated total generation of 153.019 million tonnes in 2019. (Rural population in 2019 was 551.62 million people and the latest data on rural waste generation is from 2014 at 0.76 kg/capita/day, for a total of 153.019 million tonnes). Data on MSW generation in rural areas is based on door-to-door surveys and the recyclables are partly counted.
